meanings.definition: Concerned with beauty or the appreciation of beauty.
meanings.sent1: She has an aesthetic sense that appreciates the beauty of nature.
meanings.sent2: The painting has an aesthetic appeal that draws people in.
meanings.sent3: His aesthetic eye always spots the most beautiful flowers in the garden.
meanings.sent4: The sunset painted the sky with an aesthetic touch of colors.
meanings.sent5: The garden was an aesthetic paradise of colors and shapes.

meanings.definition: A set of principles underlying and guiding the work of a particular artist or artistic movement.
meanings.sent1: The artist followed a unique aesthetic in all his paintings.
meanings.sent2: The Renaissance period had a distinct aesthetic that influenced many artists.
meanings.sent3: The art teacher explained the aesthetic of the Impressionist movement in class.
meanings.sent4: The aesthetic of minimalism focuses on simplicity and clean lines.
meanings.sent5: The Gothic architecture showcased a dark and mysterious aesthetic.

meanings.definition: A particular taste or approach to the visual qualities of an object or scene.
meanings.sent1: Her aesthetic leans towards bright colors and bold patterns.
meanings.sent2: The interior designer has a unique aesthetic that sets her apart.
meanings.sent3: His aesthetic for fashion always includes a touch of vintage flair.
meanings.sent4: The movie director's aesthetic for lighting creates a dramatic atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The garden's aesthetic was a blend of modern and traditional styles.
